intro: Galatella cretica, commonly known as the Cretan galatella, is a flowering plant native to the island of Crete in Greece. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are pinnately divided, giving it a delicate, fern-like appearance. Galatella cretica is often found in rocky or limestone soils and is considered a rare species within its native habitat.
